lines.text: Alarum. Enter fighting, Soldiers of both armies; then BRUTUS, CATO, LUCILIUS, and others

lines.speaker: cato
lines.text: What bastard doth not? Who will go with me? I will proclaim my name about the field: I am the son of Marcus Cato, ho! A foe to tyrants, and my country's friend; I am the son of Marcus Cato, ho!

lines.speaker: brutus
lines.text: And I am Brutus, Marcus Brutus, I; Brutus, my country's friend; know me for Brutus!

lines.speaker: lucilius
lines.text: O young and noble Cato, art thou down? Why, now thou diest as bravely as Titinius; And mayst be honour'd, being Cato's son.

lines.speaker: lucilius
lines.text: Only I yield to die: There is so much that thou wilt kill me straight; Kill Brutus, and be honour'd in his death.

lines.speaker: first soldier
lines.text: We must not. A noble prisoner!

lines.speaker: second soldier
lines.text: Room, ho! Tell Antony, Brutus is ta'en.

lines.speaker: first soldier
lines.text: I'll tell the news. Here comes the general. Brutus is ta'en, Brutus is ta'en, my lord.

lines.speaker: lucilius
lines.text: Safe, Antony; Brutus is safe enough: I dare assure thee that no enemy Shall ever take alive the noble Brutus: The gods defend him from so great a shame! When you do find him, or alive or dead, He will be found like Brutus, like himself.

lines.speaker: antony
lines.text: This is not Brutus, friend; but, I assure you, A prize no less in worth: keep this man safe; Give him all kindness: I had rather have Such men my friends than enemies. Go on, And see whether Brutus be alive or dead; And bring us word unto Octavius' tent How every thing is chanced.
